intro: Ipomoea setosa subsp. setosa, commonly known as the hairy morning glory, is a species of flowering plant in the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue to purple in color, opening in the morning and closing by midday. Its leaves are heart-shaped with a rough texture, and the plant thrives in full sun to partial shade. Ipomoea setosa subsp. setosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display.
